job description:
Every day, the people of TSYS® and Netspend® improve lives and businesses around the globe through payments. We make it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions including credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. We are \"People-Centered Payments\", and our team has the unique opportunity to help create a world in which payments make people's lives easier and better. This is both a tremendous honor and an important responsibility for those who accept the challenge. If you are looking to make a valuable difference for people everywhere — and for yourself — we may have the right place for you.

Summary of This Role

Install, configure, maintain, support, and secure the organization's network communications, including LANs and/or WANs. Identifies network problems, isolates root causes, and initiates corrective action. Determines priority of action and additional resources required, based on severity of service interruption. Provides technical analysis to all customers to isolate issues and develop strategies to restore or activate services. Interacts with Telecommunication Engineers, LAN Administrators, and transmission and RF staff regarding ongoing network activities. Ascertains compliance with security, safety, and environmental guidelines. Generates reports on network performance, trouble-shooting results, and routine maintenance of network elements. This role requires individuals to work within the demands a global 24x7 High availability transaction oriented network. Ability to translate business requirements into network requirements and collaboratively work with other technical teams to deliver an overall solution.

What Part Will You Play?
  • Acts as a Technical SME to drive collaboration in a team environment
  • Serves as a Technical SME on unusually complex projects , demonstrating expert level problem solving skills with the Network
  • As the Technical SME, recognizes and resolves unusually complex problems and issues according to corporate policies
  • Manages unusually complex project tasks independently with internal and external clients
  • Provides mentorship to entry/lower level team members
  • At an expert/Technical SME level, independently designs, configures, tests, documents, and implements unusually complex network designs and components
  • Develops ad-hoc, unusually complex reports on network performance, trouble-shooting results, and maintenance of network elements
  • Acts as a Technical SME to independently utilize tools within the network to analyze client networks
What Are We Looking For in This Role?

Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree
  • Relevant Experience or Degree in: No degree specified
  • Typically Minimum 8+ Years Relevant Exp
  • 8 + years of enterprise networking experience and/or a Bachelor's Degree
Preferred Qualifications
  • Appropriate advanced industry network certifications are preferred.
What Are Our Desired Skills and Capabilities?
  • Skills / Knowledge - As a highly skilled specialist, contributes to the development of concepts and techniques. Completes complex tasks in creative and effective ways. Ensures tasks of team are competed in a timely manner.
  • Job Complexity - Consistently works on complex assignments requiring some independent action and a high degree of initiative to resolve issues. Makes recommendations for new procedures. Oversees a team and coordinates daily work covering multiple assignments.
  • Supervision - Determine methods and procedures on new assignments with some independence. Often acts as a facilitator for group. Is formal team leader.
  • Dynamic Routing - Configure industry standard dynamic routing protocols including but not limited to BGP and OSPF.
  • WAN Optimization and QoS - WAN optimization and QoS on global MPLS network carrying voice and data.
  • Load Balancing - Global DNS load balancing and local application load balancing.
